response: "I can't keep up with everyone's expectations anymore. It's like I'm drowning in this never-ending quest for perfection."
"Why do I feel like I have to be flawless in every aspect of my life? It's exhausting and overwhelming."
"I can't help but compare myself to others constantly. It's like a constant battle to be better, to be the best. But it's driving me insane!"
"I don't even know what 'perfect' means anymore. It feels like an unattainable goal that keeps slipping away from me."
"The pressure to always look a certain way is suffocating. I can't help but question my own beauty and worth."
"I'm losing touch with reality. The constant need to be perfect is distorting my perception of what's real and what's not."
"Every time I make a mistake, I feel like I've failed everyone. It's like I'm not allowed to be human and make errors."
"It feels like society is constantly judging me, waiting for me to slip up. I'm starting to question if I'll ever be good enough."
"No matter how hard I try, it never seems to be enough. It's like I'm on an endless treadmill, running towards an unattainable goal."
"I'm losing sight of who I am and what truly matters. This obsession with perfection is tearing me apart."
